articles.title: The tragedy of Michel Barnier - POLITICO Europe
articles.description: The former European commissioner is expected to go down in history as France’s shortest-serving prime minister.
articles.content: After all, if he could run rings round the British in Brexit negotiations, he could surely pull off one final legendary coup, assuage fears about the debt bomb, and steady the ship for President Emma… [+1095 chars]

articles.title: Erdoğan’s risky play in Syria - POLITICO Europe
articles.description: Aleppo’s fall has much to do with the Turkish leader’s geopolitical maneuverings — particularly his irritation with Assad for spurning a long-standing offer of reconciliation.
articles.content: Overall, the front lines of Syria’s civil war have been stagnant since 2020, although there have been fierce episodic clashes. For the past four years, Assad has controlled much of the country and it… [+2775 chars]
